runs.lessonsLearned: Parallel agents for audit tasks (dedup, console, any-types) works well. Initial survey estimates were inflated — actual issues much smaller.
Parallel agents for mechanical edits (aria-labels + Zod) works perfectly. Both completed in ~5 min with zero conflicts since they touched different files.
4 parallel wave agents with strict file ownership prevents conflicts. Leader handles shared hub file (page.tsx) after all agents complete. Security review caught HIGH bug that all 4 agents missed.
Lightweight parallel (Task run_in_background) works well for independent module creation. Mock server pattern in tests needs updating when adding annotations - spread args pattern is more resilient.
T3 button sweep across 52 files worked well as single agent. Facility layout auth gap caught by security reviewer — defense-in-depth review pays off.
Code review caught missing FK cascade that would crash member removal. Security review caught IDOR + race condition. Both fixed before merge.
Both code and security reviews approve. Server-side auth enforcement validated. Client-only time gates acceptable when only trusted users (coaches) have access.
Both reviewers caught Cache-Control and x-forwarded-host issues independently. Security reviewer uniquely found resource exhaustion and missing RLS policies.
